explanation: The library code shown does not itself contain a static call-cycle that makes MHD_get_fdset recursively call itself. MHD_get_fdset simply calls MHD_get_fdset2, and MHD_get_fdset2 may call MHD_DLOG which in turn invokes an application-supplied callback (daemon->custom_error_log). An indirect recursion (e.g. MHD_get_fdset -> MHD_get_fdset2 -> MHD_DLOG -> custom_error_log -> MHD_get_fdset or MHD_DLOG -> custom_error_log -> MHD_DLOG) can only occur if the application supplies a callback that calls back into the library (or into MHD_DLOG) — i.e. it is caused by the application’s choice of function pointer target, not by an inherent cycle in the library code itself. Thus the presented library code does not, by itself, violate MISRA C:2023 Rule 17.2. (If the whole integrated system including the application contains such a callback that creates a cycle, then the overall system would violate 17.2, but that is a consequence of the application’s code/configuration rather than of the MHD_get_fdset implementation.)
